Chapter 6: Ancient People's Inscriptions on the Mountain
Preface: Many ancient people have left inscriptions on Mount Lu through the ages. Their clear words and beautiful phrases have long been passed down by word of mouth.
The old men and simple folk of the mountain transmit them without interruption.
Even in the deepest valleys and remote places rarely visited by people,ğŸ”½the inscriptions of ancient people are still there.
The people who left these inscriptions are now separated from us by hundreds of years.
Yet through their words, we can imagine their style.
It is as if we are walking side by side with them.
And as if we are sitting together at a desk, personally conversing with them.
The transmission of literature and art
is like this. How can we ignore it?
Therefore, the poems of the virtuous men of the Jin and Song dynasties in the mountains
can often be seen.
In the early years of the Northern Song, Zhang Huishi roamed Mount Lu for a long time.
His poems about the beautiful scenery and rocks are often on point.
There is a collection of his poems on Mount Lu.
Since the peaceful years, people have appreciated elegant literature.
Officials of the imperial court, when climbing high and looking into the distance,
are also inspired by the wind of famous poets and talented literati.
All the writings left behind were written in a single moment.
On the first day of each year, the people are close.
They do not suffer from having nothing to transmit.
Now I record the poems of people before the Tang Dynasty.
They are arranged in chapters.
I value the ears and despise the eyes to take away what I want.

Visiting the Old Residence of Tao Qian, with an Introduction Bai Juyi I have long admired Tao Yuanming as a person.
In the past years of leisure by the Wei River,
I once wrote sixteen poems in the style of Tao.

I also wrote a poem, saying:
Dirt and dust do not stain jade.
A divine phoenix does not peck at foul things.
Alas! Tao Jingjie,
Born in the Jin and Song dynasties,
With a mind that truly upholds something,
His mouth can never speak.
Forever thinking of the son of Guzhu,
Shaking off his clothes and going to Mount Shouyang,
Yi and Qi each with one body,
Starving to death is not difficult.
The master had five sons,
Who shared his hunger and cold.
The food in their intestines was not enough.
The robe on his body was incomplete.
He was asked repeatedly but did not rise.
This can be called true virtue.
After I was born, I am a descendant of your family.
Five hundred years have passed.
Every time I read the biography of Wu Liu,
My eyes imagine and my heart is clenched.
In the past, I once composed a poem on his remaining style.
Writing it in sixteen chapters.
Now I come to visit the old house.

I will grow old and die in this hill garden.
The ancient village of Chaisang.

I do not see chrysanthemums by the fence.

Although the descendants have heard of it.
